tweets.text:
Concerns over flood defences on sections of the River Adur are set to be addressed after issues were raised to the #Adur #& #Worthing watchdog.

The Councils' Scrutiny Committee invited @EnvAgency to discuss the ¬£31 million Adur Tidal Walls scheme:

‚û°Ô∏è https://t.co/Uin3f3TAgB https://t.co/M7ZB7DFZC9

Hushed up in the 90s #Capperpass since admitted their actions of dumping tonnes of contaminated over the area. The long lasting affects have been found through an @EnvAgency research project in the area, which found toxins & heavy metals. Why are they churning up the soil? üçÉüíöüçÉ https://t.co/40JPHufSx1

4/11 Using long-term data from 66,874 samples collected by @EnvAgency across thousands of waterbodies in England, we were able to explore patterns of abundance change for these different invertebrate taxa over time since 2002. https://t.co/lae2moGXDO

This morning I met with farmers in #Lymm to see the damage to the River #Bollin flood defences following Storm Christoph now that waters have receded. Huge hole in the river bank, trees down impeding flow and blocked storm gullies needing attention by @EnvAgencyNW @johncurtinEA https://t.co/8stkc9rXsS

EA now need to play their part too. Decades of neglect. SSSI at risk.

tweets.text: @GarethSimkins @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland Fly-tipping nearby upstream is constant menace. That said, all local managing bodies are aware of this. Trash trap overspill also out of control. Riverbanks strewn with debris downstream leading to reservoir. Deplorable neglect.

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

Our Field Team have been out and about in North Lancashire doing maintenance activities at Wade Brook #Leyland 

They have been busy opening water course channels by doing tree work, cutting vegetation back and taking out big blockages to reduce the threat of #flood risk. https://t.co/QRjOwwI9Qo
